intro: Ceratolimon rechingeri, commonly known as the Afghan sandthorn, is a shrub native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant has adapted to harsh environments with its deep root system and succulent leaves. It produces small, red fruits that are edible but have a bitter taste. Due to its resilience, it is often found in desert and semi-desert habitats.
